chapter_description: This chapter introduces the concept of linear regression, its types, and its applications. It covers the basics of simple linear regression, including the equation, assumptions, and evaluation metrics.

This chapter covers the mathematical concepts required for linear regression, including slope and intercept, coefficient of determination (R-squared), and mean squared error (MSE). It also explains the ordinary least squares (OLS) method for estimating model parameters.

This chapter provides an introduction to Python programming for data analysis, including data types, variables, control structures, functions, and object-oriented programming. It also covers essential libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib.

This chapter explains how to prepare data for linear regression, including data cleaning, handling missing values, data transformation, and feature scaling. It also covers techniques for handling categorical variables and outliers.
This chapter introduces the Scikit-learn library, a popular Python library for machine learning. It covers the basics of Scikit-learn, including data loading, model selection, and model evaluation.

chapter_name: Building a Simple Linear Regression Model
chapter_description: This chapter provides a step-by-step guide to building a simple linear regression model using Scikit-learn. It covers data loading, data preprocessing, model training, and model evaluation.

This chapter explains how to evaluate and interpret the performance of a linear regression model, including metrics such as R-squared, MSE, and coefficient of determination. It also covers techniques for visualizing model performance.

This chapter discusses common issues that may arise when building a linear regression model, including multicollinearity, heteroscedasticity, and non-linearity. It also provides best practices for building and evaluating linear regression models.
This chapter explains how to deploy and maintain a linear regression model in a production environment. It covers techniques for model serialization, model serving, and model monitoring.
